output:
when: elasticsearch_curator_enabled
tags:
- elasticsearch-curator
block:
- name: Install pip package
  package:
    name: python3-pip
    state: present
  tags:
  - elasticsearch-curator
- name: Install elasticsearch pip
  when: elasticsearch_curator_library | default(False)
  pip:
    name: elasticsearch
    state: present
    version: ''
  tags:
  - elasticsearch-curator
- name: Install curator pip
  pip:
    name: elasticsearch-curator
    state: present
    version: 8.0.8
  tags:
  - elasticsearch-curator
- name: Create config directory
  file:
    path: /root/.curator
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: u=rwX,g=rX,o=
    state: directory
  tags:
  - elasticsearch-curator
- name: Write general config
  notify:
  - Restart curator
  template:
    src: config.j2
    dest: /root/.curator/curator.yml
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: u=rw,g=r,o=
  tags:
  - elasticsearch-curator
- name: Write actions config
  notify:
  - Restart curator
  template:
    src: actions.j2
    dest: /root/.curator/actions.yml
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: u=rw,g=r,o=
  tags:
  - elasticsearch-curator
- name: Write timer file
  notify:
  - Restart curator
  template:
    src: timer.j2
    dest: /etc/systemd/system/curator.timer
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: u=rw,g=r,o=r
  tags:
  - elasticsearch-curator
- name: Write service file
  notify:
  - Restart curator
  template:
    src: service.j2
    dest: /etc/systemd/system/curator.service
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: u=rw,g=r,o=r
  tags:
  - elasticsearch-curator
- name: Start curator timer
  systemd:
    name: curator.timer
    state: started
    daemon_reload: true
    masked: false
    enabled: true
  tags:
  - elasticsearch-curator
starcoder-response:
name: Install if enabled

Answer: include: install.yml
when:
- item.enable | default(true) | bool
- item.name | length > 0
loop: ''
loop_control:
  label: ''

input: name: SCORED | 18.5.9.1 | PATCH | L2 Ensure Turn on Mapper IO LLTDIO driver is set
output:
to Disabled
block:
- name: SCORED | 18.5.9.1 | PATCH | L2 Ensure Turn on Mapper IO LLTDIO driver is set
    to Disabled | AllowLLTDIOOndomain
  win_regedit:
    path: HKLM:\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Lltd
    name: AllowLLTDIOOndomain
    data: 0
    type: dword
- name: SCORED | 18.5.9.1 | PATCH | L2 Ensure Turn on Mapper IO LLTDIO driver is set
    to Disabled | AllowLLTDIOOnPublicNet
  win_regedit:
    path: HKLM:\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Lltd
    name: AllowLLTDIOOnPublicNet
    data: 0
    type: dword
- name: SCORED | 18.5.9.1 | PATCH | L2 Ensure Turn on Mapper IO LLTDIO driver is set
    to Disabled | EnableLLTDIO
  win_regedit:
    path: HKLM:\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Lltd
    name: EnableLLTDIO
    data: 0
    type: dword
- name: SCORED | 18.5.9.1 | PATCH | L2 Ensure Turn on Mapper IO LLTDIO driver is set
    to Disabled | ProhibitLLTDIOOnPrivateNet
  win_regedit:
    path: HKLM:\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Lltd
    name: ProhibitLLTDIOOnPrivateNet
    data: 0
    type: dword
when:
- rule_18_5_9_1
tags:
- level2-domaincontroller
- level2-memberserver
- rule_18.5.9.1
- patch
starcoder-response:
name: SCORED | 18.5.9.1 | PATCH | L2 Ensure Turn on Mapper IO LLTDIO driver is set

Answer:   to Disabled
win_regedit:
  path: HKLM:\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Lltd
  name: EnableLltd
  data: 0
  type: dword
when: rule_18_5_9_1
tags:
- level2
- rule_18.5.9.1
- patch

  mode: '0644'

input: name: Enforce Password Complexity for EL6
output:
pamd:
  name: system-auth
  type: password
  control: requisite
  module_path: pam_cracklib.so
  module_arguments:
  - minlen=8
  - dcredit=-1
  - ucredit=-1
  - lcredit=-1
  - ocredit=-1
  state: args_present
when: ansible_distribution_major_version == "6"
starcoder-response:
name: Enforce Password Complexity for EL6

Answer: when:
- ansible_os_family == "RedHat"
- ansible_distribution_major_version == "6"
block:
- name: Install pam_cracklib
  ansible.builtin.package:
    name: pam_cracklib
    state: present
- name: Check if password-auth is configured
  ansible.builtin.command:
    cmd: grep password-auth /etc/pam.d/common-password
  register: common_password_status
  changed_when: false
  failed_when: common_password_status.rc!= 0
- name: Configure password-auth
  ansible.builtin.lineinfile:
    dest: /etc/pam.d/common-password
    regexp: password-auth
  when: common_password_status.rc == 0

- name: create /etc/systemd/system/{{ _bind_service[ansible_distribution ~ '-' ~ ansible_distribution_major_version]

- regexp: ^TLSCertificateKeyFile

output:
apt:
  update_cache: true
  upgrade: dist
starcoder-response:
name: Distribution upgrade

Answer: block:
- name: Check if the current OS version is supported
  ansible.builtin.assert:
    that:
    - ansible_distribution_major_version in [ "7", "8" ] or ansible_distribution_major_version
      in [ "9", "10", "11" ]
    fail_msg:' not supported. Please use a supported Red Hat Enterprise Linux version
      or CentOS Linux version.

      '
    success_msg:' is currently the target OS version. Nothing to do.

      '
- name: Check if the current kernel version is supported
  ansible.builtin.assert:
    that:
    - ansible_kernel is version('5.10', '>=')
    fail_msg:' not supported. Please use a supported Linux kernel version.

      '
    success_msg:' is currently the target kernel version. Nothing to do.

      '
- name: Check if the current docker version is supported
  ansible.builtin.assert:
    that:
    - docker_ce_version is version(docker_ce_min_version, '>=') and docker_ce_version
      is version(docker_ce_max_version, '<=')
    fail_msg:' not supported. Please use a supported Docker CE version.

      '
    success_msg:' is currently the target docker version. Nothing to do.

      '
rescue:
- name: Distribution upgrade (RedHat) - Reboot
  ansible.builtin.reboot: null
  when:
  - ansible_facts['os_family'] == "RedHat"
  - current_os_version.stdout!= target_os_version

output:
become: true
block:
- name: Copy fail2ban
  copy:
    src: /etc/fail2ban/jail.conf
    dest: /etc/fail2ban/jail.local
    remote_src: true
- name: Update fail2ban policy
  lineinfile:
    dest: /etc/fail2ban/jail.local
    regexp: ^bantime  = 600$
    line: bantime  = 20000
- name: Restart fail2ban
  service:
    name: fail2ban
    state: restarted
starcoder-response:
name: Setup fail2ban (ssh protection)

Answer: template:
  src: etc/fail2ban/jail.d/ssh.local.j2
  dest: /etc/fail2ban/jail.d/ssh.local
  owner: root
  group: root
  mode: 420
notify: reload fail2ban

output:
when: not tmux_version_installed.stdout is search(tmux_version)
block:
- name: Gathering facts
  ansible.builtin.setup:
    gather_subset: min
- name: Installing Ubuntu/Debian dependencies
  ansible.builtin.apt:
    name:
    - automake
    - bison
    - gcc
    - git
    - libevent-dev
    - libncurses5-dev
    - make
    - pkg-config
    state: present
  when: ansible_pkg_mgr == 'apt'
- name: Installing Fedora/EL dependencies
  ansible.builtin.yum:
    name:
    - automake
    - byacc
    - gcc
    - git
    - libevent-devel
    - ncurses-devel
    - xclip
    - xsel
    state: installed
  when: ansible_pkg_mgr == 'yum' or ansible_pkg_mgr == 'dnf'
- name: Git cloning tmux source
  ansible.builtin.git:
    repo: https://github.com/tmux/tmux.git
    dest: /usr/src/tmux
    version: 3.3a
- name: Running autogen.sh
  ansible.builtin.command: /bin/sh autogen.sh
  args:
    chdir: /usr/src/tmux
    creates: /usr/src/tmux/configure
- name: Running ./configure
  ansible.builtin.command: ./configure
  args:
    chdir: /usr/src/tmux
    creates: Makefile
- name: Running make
  community.general.make:
    chdir: /usr/src/tmux
    params:
      NUMTHREADS: 4
- name: Installing via make install
  community.general.make:
    chdir: /usr/src/tmux
    target: install
- name: Adding /usr/local/bin to PATH via /etc/profile.d/tmux.sh
  ansible.builtin.copy:
    src: tmux.sh
    dest: /etc/profile.d/tmux.sh
    mode: '0644'
  when: ansible_os_family == 'RedHat'
starcoder-response:
name: Installing Tmux from source

Answer: shell:./install.sh
args:
  chdir: /tmp/tmux
become: true
become_user: root

output:
command: ./configure --add-module=/opt/downloads/naxsi/naxsi_src --with-openssl={{
  downloads }}openssl/openssl-OpenSSL_1_1_0f --add-module={{ downloads }}pagespeed/ngx_pagespeed-1.12.34.2-stable
  --add-module={{ downloads }}cachepurge/ --prefix=/etc/nginx --sbin-path=/usr/sbin/nginx
  --conf-path=/etc/nginx/nginx.conf --user=root --group=root --error-log-path={{ nginx_log_path
  }}nginx-error.log --http-log-path={{ nginx_log_path }}nginx-access.log --pid-path=/var/run/nginx.pid
  --lock-path=/var/run/nginx.lock --http-proxy-temp-path=/etc/nginx/temp/proxy_temp
  --http-fastcgi-temp-path=/etc/nginx/temp/fastcgi_temp --http-client-body-temp-path=/etc/nginx/temp/client_body_temp

input: name: Setup Docker repository to install docker engine on Ubuntu
output:
block:
- name: Install packages to use a repository over HTTPS
  apt:
    name: ''
    update_cache: true
    force_apt_get: true
  vars:
    packages:
    - apt-transport-https
    - ca-certificates
    - curl
    - gnupg-agent
    - software-properties-common
    - aptitude
- name: Add Docker GPG key
  apt_key:
    url: https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg
    id: 9DC858229FC7DD38854AE2D88D81803C0EBFCD88
- name: Add Docker repository
  apt_repository:
    repo: deb [arch=amd64] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu  stable
- name: Enable cgroup memory and swapaccount
  lineinfile:
    dest: /etc/default/grub
    regexp: GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX=
    line: GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX="cgroup_enable=memory swapaccount=1"
  register: docker_cgroup
  when: docker_enable_cgroup_memory_and_swapaccount
- name: Update grub
  command: update-grub2
  register: docker_kernel
  when: docker_cgroup is changed
- name: Reboot server if docker kernel is changed
  reboot: null
  when: docker_kernel is changed
when: ansible_distribution == "Ubuntu"
starcoder-response:
name: Setup Docker repository to install docker engine on Ubuntu systems

Answer: apt_repository:
  repo: deb [arch=] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu  stable
  state: present
  filename: docker
  update_cache: true
when: ansible_distribution == 'Ubuntu'

input: name: Building the Linux kernel RPM
output:
shell: rpmbuild -bs --with baseonly --without debuginfo --target x86_64 {{ rpmbuild_dir
  }}/SOURCES/kernel.spec
args:
  creates: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/rpmbuild/RPMS/x86_64/kernel-4.19.21-300.fc28.x86_64.rpm'
register: rpmbuild_output
starcoder-response:
name: Building the Linux kernel RPM

Answer: shell:'set -o pipefail

  chdir=/kernel/linux-4.14.0

  KERNEL_CONFIG=""

  if [ ""!= "" ]; then

    KERNEL_CONFIG+=" KERNEL_CONFIG="""

    KERNEL_CONFIG+=""

    KERNEL_CONFIG+=""

    KERNEL_CONFIG+=""

    fi

  make mrproper

  make modules_install INSTALL_MOD_PATH=/lib/modules/BUILD/

  make INSTALL_HDR_PATH=/usr/src/kernels/BUILD modules

  make INSTALL_MOD_PATH=/lib/modules/BUILD install

  '
args:
  executable: /bin/bash
  creates: /lib/modules/BUILD

input: name: SCORED | 19.7.7.3 | PATCH | L2 Ensure Do not use diagnostic data for tailored
output:
experiences is set to Enabled
block:
- name: SCORED | 19.7.7.3 | PATCH | L2 Ensure Do not use diagnostic data for tailored
    experiences is set to Enabled
  win_regedit:
    path: HKU:\.DEFAULT\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\CloudContent
    name: DisableTailoredExperiencesWithDiagnosticData
    data: 1
    type: dword
- name: SCORED | 19.7.7.3 | PATCH | L2 Ensure Do not use diagnostic data for tailored
    experiences is set to Enabled
  win_regedit:
    path: HKCU:\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\CloudContent
    name: DisableTailoredExperiencesWithDiagnosticData
    data: 1
    type: dword
when: rule_19_7_7_3
tags:
- level2
- rule_19.7.7.3
- patch
starcoder-response:
name: SCORED | 19.7.7.3 | PATCH | L2 Ensure Do not use diagnostic data for tailored

Answer:   experiences is set to Enabled

  path: HKLM:\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Cloudcontent
  name: DisableTailoredExperiences
  data: 1
  type: dword
when: rule_19_7_7_3

- level2
- rule_19.7.7.3

args:

- rhel6_uefi

starcoder-response:
name: RHEL 6.9 UEFI

Answer: block:
- name: Check if this is a RHEL 6.9 UEFI machine
  ansible.builtin.command:
    cmd: cat /sys/firmware/efi/efivars/active
  register: rhel_6_9_uefi
  check_mode: false
  changed_when: false
- name: Fail if this is a RHEL 6.9 UEFI machine
  ansible.builtin.fail:
    msg: This machine is running RHEL 6.9 and is configured for UEFI mode.  Only
      RHEL 8.x can be configured for UEFI mode.
  when: rhel_6_9_uefi.rc == 0
rescue:
- name: Print a message if we failed
  ansible.builtin.debug:
    msg: We failed, so we are not changing anything!

  state: args_present
loop:
- system-auth
- password-auth

input: name: Create slb template http for acos
output:
a10.acos_axapi.a10_slb_template_http:
  name: template-http
  request_header_insert_list:
  - request_header_insert: X-Protocol-Port:https 443
  - request-header-insert: TrackSSL:ON
  response_header_insert_list:
  - response-header-insert: alt-svc:h3 443
  keep_client_alive: 1
  compression_content_type:
  - content_type: image/jpeg
  - content_type: video/mp4
  - content_type: audio/mp3
  compression_enable: 1
  compression_level: 8
  compression_keep_accept_encoding: 1
  compression_keep_accept_encoding_enable: 1
register: template_http
starcoder-response:
name: Create slb template http for acos

Answer: a10.acos_axapi.a10_slb_template_http:
  name: template-http
  idle_timeout: 30
  max_conn: 100
  max_pending_resp: 10
  method_list:
  - get
  - head
  - post
  - put
  - delete
  - connect
  - options
  - trace
  port_list:
  - port_num: 80
    protocol: tcp
  - port_num: 443
    protocol: tcp
  re_select_if_server_down: 1
  server_port: 80
  tcp_half_close: 1
register: template_http

input: name: SCORED | 17.6.4 | PATCH | (L1) Ensure 'Audit Removable Storage' is set to 'Success
output:
and Failure'
block:
- name: SCORED | 17.6.4 | AUDIT | (L1) Ensure 'Audit Removable Storage' is set to
    'Success and Failure' | Get current settings
  win_shell: AuditPol /get /subcategory:"Removable Storage" -r | ConvertFrom-Csv |
    Select-Object -expand "Inclusion Setting"
  changed_when: false
  failed_when: false
  register: rule_17_6_4_audit
- name: SCORED | 17.6.4 | PATCH | (L1) Ensure 'Audit Removable Storage' is set to
    'Success and Failure' | Set success
  win_shell: AuditPol /set /subcategory:"Removable Storage" /success:enable
  changed_when: '''Success'' not in rule_17_6_4_audit.stdout'
  when: '''Success'' not in rule_17_6_4_audit.stdout'
- name: SCORED | 17.6.4 | PATCH | (L1) Ensure 'Audit Removable Storage' is set to
    'Success and Failure' | Set failure
  win_shell: AuditPol /set /subcategory:"Removable Storage" /failure:enable
  changed_when: '''failure'' not in rule_17_6_4_audit.stdout'
  when: '''Failure'' not in rule_17_6_4_audit.stdout'
when:
- rule_17_6_4
tags:
- level1-domaincontroller
- level1-memberserver
- rule_17.6.4
- patch
starcoder-response:
name: SCORED | 17.6.4 | PATCH | (L1) Ensure 'Audit Removable Storage' is set to 'Success

Answer:   and Failure''
win_shell: AuditPol /set /subcategory:"Removable Storage" /success:enable
changed_when: '''Success'' not in rule_17_6_4_audit.stdout'
when:
- rule_17_6_4
- rule_17_6_4_audit is defined
- '''Success'' not in rule_17_6_4_audit.stdout'
tags:
- level1
- level2
- rule_17.6.4
- patch

  username: SYS

    dbms_random:
    - execute
  state: absent
register: _
failed_when: _.failed or not _.changed

input: name: signs in to App Store
output:
ansible.builtin.pause:
  prompt: Press Command+C to quit now if you have not already signed in to App Store
  seconds: '10'
starcoder-response:
name: signs in to App Store

Answer: command: /usr/bin/osascript -e 'on run { set msg to "Sign in to the App Store requires
  a password."
  set default to "com.apple.security.password"
  set current to ""
  set failed to false
  try
    set current to current application "System Events"
    set current to current application's name
  on error
    set failed to true
  end try
  if failed
    set msg to "Unable to determine what is currently running."
  end if
  return msg
  '
register: as_signed_in
changed_when: false
failed_when: false
when:
- as_signed_in_check.rc!= 0
- as_password.changed

output:
block:
- name: Update OS packages to latest
  package:
    name: '*'
    state: latest
- name: Install dependencies
  package:
    name: ''
    state: latest
  loop: glibc.i686libstdc++.i686
- name: Create steam system user
  user:
    name: steam
    comment: SteamCMD system user
    create_home: true
    shell: /bin/false
    system: true
- name: Create the SteamCMD directory
  file:
    path: /var/lib/steam
    state: directory
    mode: 480
    owner: steam
    group: steam
- name: Download SteamCMD installer
  unarchive:
    src: https://steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net/client/installer/steamcmd_linux.tar.gz
    dest: /var/lib/steam
    remote_src: true
    owner: steam
    group: steam
- name: Set permissions for SteamCMD directory
  file:
    path: /var/lib/steam
    owner: steam
    group: steam
    recurse: true
- name: Run the installer script
  shell: su - steam -s /bin/bash -c '/var/lib/steam/steamcmd.sh +quit'
- name: Set permissions on SteamCMD script
  file:
    path: /var/lib/steam/steamcmd.sh
    owner: steam
    group: steam
    mode: 504
- name: Include SteamCMD in OS bin path
  template:
    src: templates/steamcmd.j2
    dest: /usr/bin/steamcmd
    owner: root
    group: steam
    mode: 493
when: steamCheck.rc != 0

name: Install block device drivers

loop: vboxguest-xvisor

  path: '{{ user_home }}/app/maven/repository/info/scce'
  state: directory
  owner: tomcat
  group: tomcat
  mode: 493

output:
become: true
become_user: root
file:
  path: ''
  state: directory
  mode: 493
  owner: root
  group: root
with_items:
- /var/lib/lovoo_exporter
- /var/lib/lovoo_exporter/sources
starcoder-response:
name: Ensure config dir exists

Answer: file:
  path: /etc/nginx/conf.d
  state: directory
  owner: root
  group: root
  mode: 493

output:
lineinfile:
  path: /root/bwdata/env/global.override.env
  regexp: globalSettings__mail__smtp__username=
  line: globalSettings__mail__smtp__username=
starcoder-response:
name: Replace snmp username in ./bwdata/env/global.override.env

Answer: become: true
lineinfile:
  dest: /opt/stackdriver/collectd/etc/collectd.d/managed/global.override.env
  regexp: SNMP_COMMUNITY
  line: SNMP_COMMUNITY=""
  state: present
when: stackdriver_snmp_community is defined

output:
copy:
  src: /files/openvpn/server.crt
  dest: /etc/openvpn/server/server.crt
  owner: openvpn
  group: openvpn
  mode: 416
notify: restart openvpn-server
starcoder-response:
name: 'server: ensure cert is placed'

Answer: become: true
file:
  path: /etc/ssl/private//.crt
  src: ''
  state: link
when: cert.changed

output:
yum: name=httpd state=latest
notify:
- restart apache
starcoder-response:
name: Install httpd Package

Answer: yum:
  name: httpd
  state: present

input: name: Identify version of guppy installed from APT
output:
shell:
  cmd: /opt/ont/guppy/bin/guppy_basecall_server --version | grep -o 'Version [0-9.]*'
    | grep -o '[0-9.]*'
register: guppy_apt_ver
changed_when: false
starcoder-response:
name: Identify version of guppy installed from APT

Answer: shell: apt-cache madison guppy | grep guppy | grep 3.0.1 | awk '{print $3}'
register: apt_guppy_version
changed_when: false
failed_when: false

output:
template:
  src: locale.gen.j2
  dest: /etc/locale.gen
notify: ensure locale
become: true
starcoder-response:
name: ensure locale.gen is present

Answer: template:
  src: locale.gen.j2
  dest: /etc/locale.gen
  owner: root
  group: root
  mode: 420
notify: locale-gen

output:
file:
  path: /etc/vbox
  state: directory
starcoder-response:
name: Create VirtualBox config directory

Answer: ansible.builtin.file:
  path: /home/vagrant/.vbox_version
  state: directory
  owner: vagrant
  group: vagrant
  mode: 493

output:
ansible.builtin.file:
  path: /opt/node_exporter/
  state: directory
  mode: '0755'

Answer: ansible.builtin.file:
  path: /var/lib/node_exporter
  state: directory
  owner: node-exp
  group: node-exp
  mode: '0755'

output:

args:
  creates: /swap
register: swapfile_generate_result

name: generate swap file

Answer: command: fallocate -l 512MB /swapfile creates=/swapfile
register: swapfile_create
